statements.name: PROC ASTORE
statements.description: The ASTORE procedure is an interactive procedure in which each statement runs immediately. The ASTORE procedure describes, manages, and scores with an analytic store. The analytic store is the result of a SAVESTATE statement from another analytic procedure; it is a binary file that contains that procedureâ€™s state after it completes the training phase of data analysis. Some procedures that support a SAVESTATE statement are the FACTMAC, FOREST, and SVMACHINE procedures. You can use the analytic store at a later time for scoring.

statements.name: DESCRIBE
statements.description: The DESCRIBE statement specifies the name or identifier of an analytic store either in the local file system or in a data table stored in CAS. It can also produce DS2 basic scoring code. You can edit the basic scoring code to add transformations to the input variables, flag or override the decision made for the record, work with ensembles, and so on.

arguments.name: RSTORE=
arguments.description: Specifies the CAS table that contains the analytic store. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: STORE=
arguments.description: Specifies either the file reference or the full path of a valid store file that was created earlier by another procedure that processed a SAVESTATE statement.

arguments.name: EPCODE
arguments.description: Sends DS2 language statement either to the SAS log (if you do not specify a code-file-name) or to an external code file that can run in CAS and that is identified by code-file-name, which is either the file reference or the full path and member name of the external code file.

statements.name: DOWNLOAD
statements.description: The DOWNLOAD statement retrieves an external binary analytic store that was produced by another procedure from the CAS session and stores it in the local file system.

arguments.name: RSTORE=
arguments.description: Specifies a data table that contains the state to be downloaded. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: STORE=
arguments.description: Specifies either the file reference or the full path of the local analytic store file to which the contents of the data table is downloaded.

statements.name: SCORE
statements.description: The SCORE statement enables you to score both simple and complex models.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Names the input data table for PROC ASTORE to use. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Names the output data table for PROC ASTORE to use. You must specify this option before any other options. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where

arguments.name: RSTORE=
arguments.description: Specifies the data table in CAS to contain the analytic store. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: COPYVAR=
arguments.description: Transfers one or more variables from the input data table that you specify in the DATA= option to the output data table that you specify in the OUT= option.

arguments.name: EPCODE=
arguments.description: Names the location of the optional scoring code file (which was created by the DESCRIBE statement) and loads that file into the CAS session for scoring. You can use this option when you have changed the contents of the scoring code.

statements.name: SETOPTION
statements.description: The SETOPTION statement associates a numeric value to a specified option name. During scoring with an analytic store, the value of the named option is checked. name specifies an identifier as the option name, where name must begin with an alphabetic character or underscore, contain only alphanumerics and underscores, and is limited to 200 characters. value specifies a numeric value for the named option.

statements.name: UPLOAD
statements.description: The UPLOAD statement moves an analytic store from the local file system into a data table in CAS.

arguments.name: RSTORE=
arguments.description: Specifies the CAS table to which the store is sent. CAS-libref.data-table is a two-level name, where CAS-libref refers to the caslib and session identifier, and data-table specifies the name of the output data table.

arguments.name: STORE=
arguments.description: Specifies either the file reference or the full path of the valid store file that was created earlier by some analytic engine and exists in the local file system.
